00130 static void initRawInput()
00131 {
00132 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00133 #define DEVICE_COUNT 2
00134 #else
00135 #define DEVICE_COUNT 1
00136 #endif
00137 
00138     RAWINPUTDEVICE devices[DEVICE_COUNT];
00139     memset(devices, 0, DEVICE_COUNT * sizeof(RAWINPUTDEVICE));
00140 
00141     // Initiates WM_INPUT messages from keyboard
00142     // That way GHOST can retrieve true keys
00143     devices[0].usUsagePage = 0x01;
00144     devices[0].usUsage = 0x06; /* http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/gg487473.aspx */
00145 
00146 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00147     // multi-axis mouse (SpaceNavigator, etc.)
00148     devices[1].usUsagePage = 0x01;
00149     devices[1].usUsage = 0x08;
00150 #endif
00151 
00152     if (RegisterRawInputDevices(devices, DEVICE_COUNT, sizeof(RAWINPUTDEVICE)))
00153         ; // yay!
00154     else
00155         printf("could not register for RawInput: %d\n", (int)GetLastError());
00156 
00157 #undef DEVICE_COUNT
00158 }

00160 GHOST_SystemWin32::GHOST_SystemWin32()
00161 : m_hasPerformanceCounter(false), m_freq(0), m_start(0)
00162 {
00163     m_displayManager = new GHOST_DisplayManagerWin32 ();
00164     GHOST_ASSERT(m_displayManager, "GHOST_SystemWin32::GHOST_SystemWin32(): m_displayManager==0\n");
00165     m_displayManager->initialize();
00166 
00167     m_consoleStatus = 1;
00168 
00169     // Check if current keyboard layout uses AltGr and save keylayout ID for
00170     // specialized handling if keys like VK_OEM_*. I.e. french keylayout
00171     // generates VK_OEM_8 for their exclamation key (key left of right shift)
00172     this->handleKeyboardChange();
00173     // Require COM for GHOST_DropTargetWin32 created in GHOST_WindowWin32.
00174     OleInitialize(0);
00175 
00176 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00177     m_ndofManager = new GHOST_NDOFManagerWin32(*this);
00178 #endif
00179 }
00180 
00181 GHOST_SystemWin32::~GHOST_SystemWin32()
00182 {
00183     // Shutdown COM
00184     OleUninitialize();
00185     toggleConsole(1);
00186 }

00188 
00189 GHOST_TUns64 GHOST_SystemWin32::getMilliSeconds() const
00190 {
00191     // Hardware does not support high resolution timers. We will use GetTickCount instead then.
00192     if (!m_hasPerformanceCounter) {
00193         return ::GetTickCount();
00194     }
00195 
00196     // Retrieve current count
00197     __int64 count = 0;
00198     ::QueryPerformanceCounter((LARGE_INTEGER*)&count);
00199 
00200     // Calculate the time passed since system initialization.
00201     __int64 delta = 1000*(count-m_start);
00202 
00203     GHOST_TUns64 t = (GHOST_TUns64)(delta/m_freq);
00204     return t; 
00205 }

00209 {

00211     GHOST_TUns8 numDisplays;

00213     return numDisplays;
00214 }

00224 GHOST_IWindow* GHOST_SystemWin32::createWindow(
00225     const STR_String& title, 
00226     GHOST_TInt32 left, GHOST_TInt32 top, GHOST_TUns32 width, GHOST_TUns32 height,
00227     GHOST_TWindowState state, GHOST_TDrawingContextType type,
00228     bool stereoVisual, const GHOST_TUns16 numOfAASamples, const GHOST_TEmbedderWindowID parentWindow )
00229 {
00230     GHOST_Window* window = 0;
00231     window = new GHOST_WindowWin32 (this, title, left, top, width, height, state, type, stereoVisual, numOfAASamples, parentWindow);
00232     if (window) {
00233         if (window->getValid()) {
00234             // Store the pointer to the window
00235 //          if (state != GHOST_kWindowStateFullScreen) {
00236                 m_windowManager->addWindow(window);
00237                 m_windowManager->setActiveWindow(window);
00238 //          }
00239         }
00240         else {
00241 
00242             // Invalid parent window hwnd
00243             if (((GHOST_WindowWin32*)window)->getNextWindow() == NULL) {
00244                 delete window;
00245                 window = 0;
00246                 return window;
00247             }
00248 
00249             // An invalid window could be one that was used to test for AA
00250             window = ((GHOST_WindowWin32*)window)->getNextWindow();
00251             
00252             // If another window is found, let the wm know about that one, but not the old one
00253             if (window->getValid()) {
00254                 m_windowManager->addWindow(window);
00255             }
00256             else {
00257                 delete window;
00258                 window = 0;
00259             }
00260 
00261         }
00262     }
00263     return window;
00264 }

00266 
00267 bool GHOST_SystemWin32::processEvents(bool waitForEvent)
00268 {
00269     MSG msg;
00270     bool anyProcessed = false;
00271 
00272     do {
00273         GHOST_TimerManager* timerMgr = getTimerManager();
00274 
00275         if (waitForEvent && !::PeekMessage(&msg, 0, 0, 0, PM_NOREMOVE)) {
00276 #if 1
00277 			::Sleep(1);
00278 #else
00279             GHOST_TUns64 next = timerMgr->nextFireTime();
00280             GHOST_TInt64 maxSleep = next - getMilliSeconds();
00281             
00282             if (next == GHOST_kFireTimeNever) {
00283                 ::WaitMessage();
00284             } else if(maxSleep >= 0.0) {
00285                 ::SetTimer(NULL, 0, maxSleep, NULL);
00286                 ::WaitMessage();
00287                 ::KillTimer(NULL, 0);
00288             }
00289 #endif
00290         }
00291 
00292         if (timerMgr->fireTimers(getMilliSeconds())) {
00293             anyProcessed = true;
00294         }
00295 
00296         // Process all the events waiting for us
00297         while (::PeekMessageW(&msg, 0, 0, 0, PM_REMOVE) != 0) {
00298             ::DispatchMessageW(&msg);
00299             anyProcessed = true;
00300         }
00301     } while (waitForEvent && !anyProcessed);
00302 
00303     return anyProcessed;
00304 }

00307 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::getCursorPosition(GHOST_TInt32& x, GHOST_TInt32& y) const
00308 {
00309     POINT point;
00310     if(::GetCursorPos(&point)){
00311         x = point.x;
00312         y = point.y;
00313         return GHOST_kSuccess;
00314     }
00315     return GHOST_kFailure;
00316 }

00319 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::setCursorPosition(GHOST_TInt32 x, GHOST_TInt32 y)
00320 {
00321     if (!GetActiveWindow())
00322         return GHOST_kFailure;
00323     return ::SetCursorPos(x, y) == TRUE ? GHOST_kSuccess : GHOST_kFailure;
00324 }

00326 
00327 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::getModifierKeys(GHOST_ModifierKeys& keys) const
00328 {
00329     bool down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_LSHIFT)) != 0;
00330     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftShift, down);
00331     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_RSHIFT)) != 0;
00332     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightShift, down);
00333     
00334     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_LMENU)) != 0;
00335     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftAlt, down);
00336     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_RMENU)) != 0;
00337     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightAlt, down);
00338     
00339     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_LCONTROL)) != 0;
00340     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftControl, down);
00341     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_RCONTROL)) != 0;
00342     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightControl, down);
00343     
00344     bool lwindown = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_LWIN)) != 0;
00345     bool rwindown = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_RWIN)) != 0;
00346     if(lwindown || rwindown)
00347         keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyOS, true);
00348     else
00349         keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyOS, false);
00350     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00351 }
00352 
00353 
00354 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::getButtons(GHOST_Buttons& buttons) const
00355 {
00356     /* Check for swapped buttons (left-handed mouse buttons)
00357      * GetAsyncKeyState() will give back the state of the physical mouse buttons.
00358      */
00359     bool swapped = ::GetSystemMetrics(SM_SWAPBUTTON) == TRUE;
00360 
00361     bool down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_LBUTTON)) != 0;
00362     buttons.set(swapped ? GHOST_kButtonMaskRight : GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft, down);
00363 
00364     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_MBUTTON)) != 0;
00365     buttons.set(GHOST_kButtonMaskMiddle, down);
00366 
00367     down = HIBYTE(::GetKeyState(VK_RBUTTON)) != 0;
00368     buttons.set(swapped ? GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft : GHOST_kButtonMaskRight, down);
00369     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00370 }

00372 
00373 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::init()
00374 {
00375     GHOST_TSuccess success = GHOST_System::init();
00376     
00377     /* Disable scaling on high DPI displays on Vista */
00378     HMODULE
00379     user32 = ::LoadLibraryA("user32.dll");
00380     typedef BOOL (WINAPI * LPFNSETPROCESSDPIAWARE)();
00381     LPFNSETPROCESSDPIAWARE SetProcessDPIAware =
00382         (LPFNSETPROCESSDPIAWARE)GetProcAddress(user32, "SetProcessDPIAware");
00383     if (SetProcessDPIAware)
00384         SetProcessDPIAware();
00385     FreeLibrary(user32);
00386     initRawInput();
00387 
00388     // Determine whether this system has a high frequency performance counter. */
00389     m_hasPerformanceCounter = ::QueryPerformanceFrequency((LARGE_INTEGER*)&m_freq) == TRUE;
00390     if (m_hasPerformanceCounter) {
00391         GHOST_PRINT("GHOST_SystemWin32::init: High Frequency Performance Timer available\n")
00392         ::QueryPerformanceCounter((LARGE_INTEGER*)&m_start);
00393     }
00394     else {
00395         GHOST_PRINT("GHOST_SystemWin32::init: High Frequency Performance Timer not available\n")
00396     }
00397 
00398     if (success) {
00399         WNDCLASSW wc;
00400         wc.style= CS_HREDRAW | CS_VREDRAW;
00401         wc.lpfnWndProc= s_wndProc;
00402         wc.cbClsExtra= 0;
00403         wc.cbWndExtra= 0;
00404         wc.hInstance= ::GetModuleHandle(0);
00405         wc.hIcon = ::LoadIcon(wc.hInstance, "APPICON");
00406         
00407         if (!wc.hIcon) {
00408             ::LoadIcon(NULL, IDI_APPLICATION);
00409         }
00410         wc.hCursor = ::LoadCursor(0, IDC_ARROW);
00411         wc.hbrBackground= (HBRUSH)::GetStockObject(BLACK_BRUSH);
00412         wc.lpszMenuName = 0;
00413         wc.lpszClassName= L"GHOST_WindowClass";
00414 
00415         // Use RegisterClassEx for setting small icon
00416         if (::RegisterClassW(&wc) == 0) {
00417             success = GHOST_kFailure;
00418         }
00419     }
00420     
00421     return success;
00422 }

00425 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::exit()
00426 {
00427     return GHOST_System::exit();
00428 }
00429 
00430 GHOST_TKey GHOST_SystemWin32::hardKey(GHOST_IWindow *window, RAWINPUT const& raw, int * keyDown, char * vk)
00431 {
00432     GHOST_TKey key = GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
00433 
00434 
00435     if(!keyDown)
00436         return GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
00437 
00438 
00439     GHOST_SystemWin32 *system = (GHOST_SystemWin32 *)getSystem();
00440 
00441     GHOST_ModifierKeys modifiers;
00442     system->retrieveModifierKeys(modifiers);
00443 
00444     // RI_KEY_BREAK doesn't work for sticky keys release, so we also
00445     // check for the up message
00446     unsigned int msg = raw.data.keyboard.Message;
00447     *keyDown = !(raw.data.keyboard.Flags & RI_KEY_BREAK) && msg != WM_KEYUP && msg != WM_SYSKEYUP;
00448 
00449     key = this->convertKey(window, raw.data.keyboard.VKey, raw.data.keyboard.MakeCode, (raw.data.keyboard.Flags&(RI_KEY_E1|RI_KEY_E0)));
00450     
00451     // extra handling of modifier keys: don't send repeats out from GHOST
00452     if(key >= GHOST_kKeyLeftShift && key <= GHOST_kKeyRightAlt)
00453     {
00454         bool changed = false;
00455         GHOST_TModifierKeyMask modifier;
00456         switch(key) {
00457             case GHOST_kKeyLeftShift:
00458                 {
00459                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftShift) != (bool)*keyDown);
00460                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftShift;
00461                 }
00462                 break;
00463             case GHOST_kKeyRightShift:
00464                 {
00465                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightShift) != (bool)*keyDown);
00466                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyRightShift;
00467                 }
00468                 break;
00469             case GHOST_kKeyLeftControl:
00470                 {
00471                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftControl) != (bool)*keyDown);
00472                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftControl;
00473                 }
00474                 break;
00475             case GHOST_kKeyRightControl:
00476                 {
00477                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightControl) != (bool)*keyDown);
00478                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyRightControl;
00479                 }
00480                 break;
00481             case GHOST_kKeyLeftAlt:
00482                 {
00483                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftAlt) != (bool)*keyDown);
00484                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftAlt;
00485                 }
00486                 break;
00487             case GHOST_kKeyRightAlt:
00488                 {
00489                     changed = (modifiers.get(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightAlt) != (bool)*keyDown);
00490                     modifier = GHOST_kModifierKeyRightAlt;
00491                 }
00492                 break;
00493             default: break;
00494         }
00495         
00496         if(changed)
00497         {
00498             modifiers.set(modifier, (bool)*keyDown);
00499             system->storeModifierKeys(modifiers);
00500         }
00501         else
00502         {
00503             key = GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
00504         }
00505     }
00506     
00507 
00508     if(vk) *vk = raw.data.keyboard.VKey;
00509 
00510     return key;
00511 }

00514 // This function was added in response to bug [#25715]
00515 GHOST_TKey GHOST_SystemWin32::processSpecialKey(GHOST_IWindow *window, short vKey, short scanCode) const
00516 {
00517     GHOST_TKey key = GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
00518     switch(PRIMARYLANGID(m_langId)) {
00519         case LANG_FRENCH:
00520             if(vKey==VK_OEM_8) key = GHOST_kKeyF13; // oem key; used purely for shortcuts .
00521             break;
00522     }
00523 
00524     return key;
00525 }
00526 
00527 GHOST_TKey GHOST_SystemWin32::convertKey(GHOST_IWindow *window, short vKey, short scanCode, short extend) const
00528 {
00529     GHOST_TKey key;
00530 
00531     if ((vKey >= '0') && (vKey <= '9')) {
00532         // VK_0 thru VK_9 are the same as ASCII '0' thru '9' (0x30 - 0x39)
00533         key = (GHOST_TKey)(vKey - '0' + GHOST_kKey0);
00534     }
00535     else if ((vKey >= 'A') && (vKey <= 'Z')) {
00536         // VK_A thru VK_Z are the same as ASCII 'A' thru 'Z' (0x41 - 0x5A)
00537         key = (GHOST_TKey)(vKey - 'A' + GHOST_kKeyA);
00538     }
00539     else if ((vKey >= VK_F1) && (vKey <= VK_F24)) {
00540         key = (GHOST_TKey)(vKey - VK_F1 + GHOST_kKeyF1);
00541     }
00542     else {
00543         switch (vKey) {
00544         case VK_RETURN:
00545                 key = (extend)?GHOST_kKeyNumpadEnter : GHOST_kKeyEnter; break;
00546             
00547         case VK_BACK:     key = GHOST_kKeyBackSpace;        break;
00548         case VK_TAB:      key = GHOST_kKeyTab;              break;
00549         case VK_ESCAPE:   key = GHOST_kKeyEsc;              break;
00550         case VK_SPACE:    key = GHOST_kKeySpace;            break;
00551         
00552         case VK_INSERT:
00553         case VK_NUMPAD0:
00554             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyInsert : GHOST_kKeyNumpad0;  break;
00555         case VK_END:
00556         case VK_NUMPAD1:        
00557             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyEnd : GHOST_kKeyNumpad1; break;
00558         case VK_DOWN:
00559         case VK_NUMPAD2:
00560             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyDownArrow : GHOST_kKeyNumpad2;   break;
00561         case VK_NEXT:
00562         case VK_NUMPAD3:
00563             key = (extend) ?  GHOST_kKeyDownPage : GHOST_kKeyNumpad3;   break;
00564         case VK_LEFT:
00565         case VK_NUMPAD4:
00566             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyLeftArrow : GHOST_kKeyNumpad4;   break;
00567         case VK_CLEAR:
00568         case VK_NUMPAD5:
00569             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyUnknown: GHOST_kKeyNumpad5;  break;
00570         case VK_RIGHT:
00571         case VK_NUMPAD6:
00572             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyRightArrow : GHOST_kKeyNumpad6;  break;
00573         case VK_HOME:
00574         case VK_NUMPAD7:
00575             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyHome : GHOST_kKeyNumpad7;    break;
00576         case VK_UP:
00577         case VK_NUMPAD8:
00578             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyUpArrow : GHOST_kKeyNumpad8; break;
00579         case VK_PRIOR:
00580         case VK_NUMPAD9:
00581             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyUpPage : GHOST_kKeyNumpad9;  break;
00582         case VK_DECIMAL:
00583         case VK_DELETE:
00584             key = (extend) ? GHOST_kKeyDelete : GHOST_kKeyNumpadPeriod; break;
00585 
00586         case VK_SNAPSHOT: key = GHOST_kKeyPrintScreen;      break;
00587         case VK_PAUSE:    key = GHOST_kKeyPause;            break;
00588         case VK_MULTIPLY: key = GHOST_kKeyNumpadAsterisk;   break;
00589         case VK_SUBTRACT: key = GHOST_kKeyNumpadMinus;      break;
00590         case VK_DIVIDE:   key = GHOST_kKeyNumpadSlash;      break;
00591         case VK_ADD:      key = GHOST_kKeyNumpadPlus;       break;
00592 
00593         case VK_SEMICOLON:      key = GHOST_kKeySemicolon;      break;
00594         case VK_EQUALS:         key = GHOST_kKeyEqual;          break;
00595         case VK_COMMA:          key = GHOST_kKeyComma;          break;
00596         case VK_MINUS:          key = GHOST_kKeyMinus;          break;
00597         case VK_PERIOD:         key = GHOST_kKeyPeriod;         break;
00598         case VK_SLASH:          key = GHOST_kKeySlash;          break;
00599         case VK_BACK_QUOTE:     key = GHOST_kKeyAccentGrave;    break;
00600         case VK_OPEN_BRACKET:   key = GHOST_kKeyLeftBracket;    break;
00601         case VK_BACK_SLASH:     key = GHOST_kKeyBackslash;      break;
00602         case VK_CLOSE_BRACKET:  key = GHOST_kKeyRightBracket;   break;
00603         case VK_QUOTE:          key = GHOST_kKeyQuote;          break;
00604         case VK_GR_LESS:        key = GHOST_kKeyGrLess;         break;
00605 
00606         case VK_SHIFT:
00607             key = (scanCode == 0x36)? GHOST_kKeyRightShift : GHOST_kKeyLeftShift;
00608             break;
00609         case VK_CONTROL:
00610             key = (extend)? GHOST_kKeyRightControl : GHOST_kKeyLeftControl;
00611             break;
00612         case VK_MENU:
00613             key = (extend)? GHOST_kKeyRightAlt : GHOST_kKeyLeftAlt;
00614             break;
00615         case VK_LWIN:
00616         case VK_RWIN:
00617             key = GHOST_kKeyOS;
00618             break;
00619         case VK_NUMLOCK: key = GHOST_kKeyNumLock; break;
00620         case VK_SCROLL: key = GHOST_kKeyScrollLock; break;
00621         case VK_CAPITAL: key = GHOST_kKeyCapsLock; break;
00622         case VK_OEM_8:
00623             key = ((GHOST_SystemWin32*)getSystem())->processSpecialKey(window, vKey, scanCode);
00624             break;
00625         case VK_MEDIA_PLAY_PAUSE: key = GHOST_kKeyMediaPlay; break;
00626         case VK_MEDIA_STOP: key = GHOST_kKeyMediaStop; break;
00627         case VK_MEDIA_PREV_TRACK: key = GHOST_kKeyMediaFirst; break;
00628         case VK_MEDIA_NEXT_TRACK: key = GHOST_kKeyMediaLast; break;
00629         default:
00630             key = GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
00631             break;
00632         }
00633     }
00634     
00635     return key;
00636 }
00637 
00638 GHOST_EventButton* GHOST_SystemWin32::processButtonEvent(GHOST_TEventType type, GHOST_IWindow *window, GHOST_TButtonMask mask)
00639 {
00640     return new GHOST_EventButton (getSystem()->getMilliSeconds(), type, window, mask);
00641 }
00642 
00643 
00644 GHOST_EventCursor* GHOST_SystemWin32::processCursorEvent(GHOST_TEventType type, GHOST_IWindow *Iwindow)
00645 {
00646     GHOST_TInt32 x_screen, y_screen;
00647     GHOST_SystemWin32 * system = ((GHOST_SystemWin32 * ) getSystem());
00648     GHOST_WindowWin32 * window = ( GHOST_WindowWin32 * ) Iwindow;
00649     
00650     system->getCursorPosition(x_screen, y_screen);
00651 
00652     if(window->getCursorGrabMode() != GHOST_kGrabDisable && window->getCursorGrabMode() != GHOST_kGrabNormal)
00653     {
00654         GHOST_TInt32 x_new= x_screen;
00655         GHOST_TInt32 y_new= y_screen;
00656         GHOST_TInt32 x_accum, y_accum;
00657         GHOST_Rect bounds;
00658 
00659         /* fallback to window bounds */
00660         if(window->getCursorGrabBounds(bounds)==GHOST_kFailure){
00661             window->getClientBounds(bounds);
00662         }
00663 
00664         /* could also clamp to screen bounds
00665          * wrap with a window outside the view will fail atm  */
00666 
00667         bounds.wrapPoint(x_new, y_new, 2); /* offset of one incase blender is at screen bounds */
00668 
00669         window->getCursorGrabAccum(x_accum, y_accum);
00670         if(x_new != x_screen|| y_new != y_screen) {
00671             /* when wrapping we don't need to add an event because the
00672              * setCursorPosition call will cause a new event after */
00673             system->setCursorPosition(x_new, y_new); /* wrap */
00674             window->setCursorGrabAccum(x_accum + (x_screen - x_new), y_accum + (y_screen - y_new));
00675         }else{
00676             return new GHOST_EventCursor(system->getMilliSeconds(),
00677                                          GHOST_kEventCursorMove,
00678                                          window,
00679                                          x_screen + x_accum,
00680                                          y_screen + y_accum
00681             );
00682         }
00683 
00684     }
00685     else {
00686         return new GHOST_EventCursor(system->getMilliSeconds(),
00687                                      GHOST_kEventCursorMove,
00688                                      window,
00689                                      x_screen,
00690                                      y_screen
00691         );
00692     }
00693     return NULL;
00694 }
00695 
00696 
00697 GHOST_EventWheel* GHOST_SystemWin32::processWheelEvent(GHOST_IWindow *window, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00698 {
00699     // short fwKeys = LOWORD(wParam);           // key flags
00700     int zDelta = (short) HIWORD(wParam);    // wheel rotation
00701     
00702     // zDelta /= WHEEL_DELTA;
00703     // temporary fix below: microsoft now has added more precision, making the above division not work
00704     if (zDelta <= 0 ) zDelta= -1; else zDelta= 1;   
00705     
00706     // short xPos = (short) LOWORD(lParam); // horizontal position of pointer
00707     // short yPos = (short) HIWORD(lParam); // vertical position of pointer
00708     return new GHOST_EventWheel (getSystem()->getMilliSeconds(), window, zDelta);
00709 }
00710 
00711 
00712 GHOST_EventKey* GHOST_SystemWin32::processKeyEvent(GHOST_IWindow *window, RAWINPUT const& raw)
00713 {
00714     int keyDown=0;
00715     char vk;
00716     GHOST_SystemWin32 * system = (GHOST_SystemWin32 *)getSystem();
00717     GHOST_TKey key = system->hardKey(window, raw, &keyDown, &vk);
00718     GHOST_EventKey* event;
00719 
00720     if (key != GHOST_kKeyUnknown) {
00721         char utf8_char[6] = {0};
00722         char ascii = 0;
00723 
00724         wchar_t utf16[3]={0};
00725         BYTE state[256] ={0};
00726         int r;
00727         GetKeyboardState((PBYTE)state);
00728 
00729         if(r = ToUnicodeEx(vk, 0, state, utf16, 2, 0, system->m_keylayout)) {
00730             if((r>0 && r<3)){
00731                 utf16[r]=0;
00732                 conv_utf_16_to_8(utf16,utf8_char,6);
00733             }
00734             else if (r==-1) {
00735                 utf8_char[0] = '\0';
00736             }
00737         }
00738 
00739         if(!keyDown) {
00740             utf8_char[0] = '\0';
00741             ascii='\0';
00742         }
00743         else {
00744             ascii = utf8_char[0]& 0x80?'?' : utf8_char[0];
00745         }
00746 
00747         if(0x80&state[VK_MENU]) utf8_char[0]='\0';
00748 
00749         event = new GHOST_EventKey(system->getMilliSeconds(), keyDown ? GHOST_kEventKeyDown: GHOST_kEventKeyUp, window, key, ascii, utf8_char);
00750         
00751 #ifdef GHOST_DEBUG
00752         std::cout << ascii << std::endl;
00753 #endif
00754     }
00755     else {
00756         event = 0;
00757     }
00758     return event;
00759 }
00760 
00761 
00762 GHOST_Event* GHOST_SystemWin32::processWindowEvent(GHOST_TEventType type, GHOST_IWindow* window)
00763 {
00764     GHOST_System* system = (GHOST_System*)getSystem();
00765 
00766     if (type == GHOST_kEventWindowActivate) {
00767         system->getWindowManager()->setActiveWindow(window);
00768     }
00769 
00770     return new GHOST_Event(system->getMilliSeconds(), type, window);
00771 }
00772 
00773 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemWin32::pushDragDropEvent(GHOST_TEventType eventType, 
00774                                                     GHOST_TDragnDropTypes draggedObjectType,
00775                                                     GHOST_IWindow* window,
00776                                                     int mouseX, int mouseY,
00777                                                     void* data)
00778 {
00779     GHOST_SystemWin32* system = ((GHOST_SystemWin32*)getSystem());
00780     return system->pushEvent(new GHOST_EventDragnDrop(system->getMilliSeconds(),
00781                                                       eventType,
00782                                                       draggedObjectType,
00783                                                       window,mouseX,mouseY,data)
00784             );
00785 }
00786 
00787 void GHOST_SystemWin32::processMinMaxInfo(MINMAXINFO * minmax)
00788 {
00789     minmax->ptMinTrackSize.x=320;
00790     minmax->ptMinTrackSize.y=240;
00791 }
00792 
00793 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00794 bool GHOST_SystemWin32::processNDOF(RAWINPUT const& raw)
00795 {
00796     bool eventSent = false;
00797     GHOST_TUns64 now = getMilliSeconds();
00798 
00799     static bool firstEvent = true;
00800     if (firstEvent) { // determine exactly which device is plugged in
00801         RID_DEVICE_INFO info;
00802         unsigned infoSize = sizeof(RID_DEVICE_INFO);
00803         info.cbSize = infoSize;
00804 
00805         GetRawInputDeviceInfo(raw.header.hDevice, RIDI_DEVICEINFO, &info, &infoSize);
00806         if (info.dwType == RIM_TYPEHID)
00807             m_ndofManager->setDevice(info.hid.dwVendorId, info.hid.dwProductId);
00808         else
00809             puts("<!> not a HID device... mouse/kb perhaps?");
00810 
00811         firstEvent = false;
00812     }
00813 
00814     // The NDOF manager sends button changes immediately, and *pretends* to
00815     // send motion. Mark as 'sent' so motion will always get dispatched.
00816     eventSent = true;
00817 
00818 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(FREE_WINDOWS64)
00819     // using Microsoft compiler & header files
00820     // they invented the RawInput API, so this version is (probably) correct.
00821     // MinGW64 also works fine with this
00822     BYTE const* data = raw.data.hid.bRawData;
00823     // struct RAWHID {
00824     // DWORD dwSizeHid;
00825     // DWORD dwCount;
00826     // BYTE  bRawData[1];
00827     // };
00828 #else
00829     // MinGW's definition (below) doesn't agree, so we need a slight
00830     // workaround until it's fixed
00831     BYTE const* data = &raw.data.hid.bRawData;
00832     // struct RAWHID {
00833     // DWORD dwSizeHid;
00834     // DWORD dwCount;
00835     // BYTE bRawData; // <== isn't this s'posed to be a BYTE*?
00836     // };
00837 #endif
00838 
00839     BYTE packetType = data[0];
00840     switch (packetType)
00841     {
00842         case 1: // translation
00843         {
00844             short* axis = (short*)(data + 1);
00845             // massage into blender view coords (same goes for rotation)
00846             short t[3] = {axis[0], -axis[2], axis[1]};
00847             m_ndofManager->updateTranslation(t, now);
00848 
00849             if (raw.data.hid.dwSizeHid == 13)
00850             { // this report also includes rotation
00851                 short r[3] = {-axis[3], axis[5], -axis[4]};
00852                 m_ndofManager->updateRotation(r, now);
00853 
00854                 // I've never gotten one of these, has anyone else?
00855                 puts("ndof: combined T + R");
00856             }
00857             break;
00858         }
00859         case 2: // rotation
00860         {
00861             short* axis = (short*)(data + 1);
00862             short r[3] = {-axis[0], axis[2], -axis[1]};
00863             m_ndofManager->updateRotation(r, now);
00864             break;
00865         }
00866         case 3: // buttons
00867         {
00868             int button_bits;
00869             memcpy(&button_bits, data + 1, sizeof(button_bits));
00870             m_ndofManager->updateButtons(button_bits, now);
00871             break;
00872         }
00873     }
00874     return eventSent;
00875 }
00876 #endif // WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00877 
00878 LRESULT WINAPI GHOST_SystemWin32::s_wndProc(HWND hwnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00879 {
00880     GHOST_Event* event = 0;
00881     bool eventHandled = false;
00882 
00883     LRESULT lResult = 0;
00884     GHOST_SystemWin32* system = ((GHOST_SystemWin32*)getSystem());
00885     GHOST_ASSERT(system, "GHOST_SystemWin32::s_wndProc(): system not initialized")
00886 
00887     if (hwnd) {
00888         GHOST_WindowWin32* window = (GHOST_WindowWin32*)::GetWindowLong(hwnd, GWL_USERDATA);
00889         if (window) {
00890             switch (msg) {
00891                 // we need to check if new key layout has AltGr
00892                 case WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE:
00893                     system->handleKeyboardChange();
00894                     break;
00896                 // Keyboard events, processed
00898                 case WM_INPUT:
00899                 {
00900                     // check WM_INPUT from input sink when ghost window is not in the foreground
00901                     if (wParam == RIM_INPUTSINK) {
00902                         if (GetFocus() != hwnd) // WM_INPUT message not for this window
00903                             return 0;
00904                     } //else wParam == RIM_INPUT
00905 
00906                     RAWINPUT raw;
00907                     RAWINPUT* raw_ptr = &raw;
00908                     UINT rawSize = sizeof(RAWINPUT);
00909 
00910                     GetRawInputData((HRAWINPUT)lParam, RID_INPUT, raw_ptr, &rawSize, sizeof(RAWINPUTHEADER));
00911 
00912                     switch (raw.header.dwType)
00913                     {
00914                     case RIM_TYPEKEYBOARD:
00915                         event = processKeyEvent(window, raw);
00916                         if (!event) {
00917                             GHOST_PRINT("GHOST_SystemWin32::wndProc: key event ")
00918                             GHOST_PRINT(msg)
00919                             GHOST_PRINT(" key ignored\n")
00920                         }
00921                         break;
00922 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00923                     case RIM_TYPEHID:
00924                         if (system->processNDOF(raw))
00925                             eventHandled = true;
00926                         break;
00927 #endif
00928                     }
00929                 break;
00930                 }
00932                 // Keyboard events, ignored
00934                 case WM_KEYDOWN:
00935                 case WM_SYSKEYDOWN:
00936                 case WM_KEYUP:
00937                 case WM_SYSKEYUP:
00938                     /* These functions were replaced by WM_INPUT*/
00939                 case WM_CHAR:
00940                     /* The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when
00941                      * a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_CHAR
00942                      * contains the character code of the key that was pressed.
00943                      */
00944                 case WM_DEADCHAR:
00945                     /* The WM_DEADCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a
00946                      * WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_DEADCHAR 
00947                      * specifies a character code generated by a dead key. A dead key is a key that 
00948                      * generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with 
00949                      * another character to form a composite character. For example, the umlaut-O 
00950                      * character (Ö) is generated by typing the dead key for the umlaut character, and
00951                      * then typing the O key.
00952                      */
00953                     break;
00954                 case WM_SYSDEADCHAR:
00955                     /* The WM_SYSDEADCHAR message is sent to the window with the keyboard focus when 
00956                      * a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. 
00957                      * WM_SYSDEADCHAR specifies the character code of a system dead key - that is, 
00958                      * a dead key that is pressed while holding down the alt key. 
00959                      */
00960                 case WM_SYSCHAR:
00961                     /* The WM_SYSCHAR message is sent to the window with the keyboard focus when 
00962                      * a WM_SYSCHAR message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. 
00963                      * WM_SYSCHAR specifies the character code of a dead key - that is, 
00964                      * a dead key that is pressed while holding down the alt key.
00965                      * To prevent the sound, DefWindowProc must be avoided by return
00966                      */
00967                     break;
00968                 case WM_SYSCOMMAND:
00969                     /* The WM_SYSCHAR message is sent to the window when system commands such as 
00970                      * maximize, minimize  or close the window are triggered. Also it is sent when ALT 
00971                      * button is press for menu. To prevent this we must return preventing DefWindowProc.
00972                      */
00973                     if(wParam==SC_KEYMENU) return 0;
00974                     break;
00976                 // Tablet events, processed
00978                 case WT_PACKET:
00979                     ((GHOST_WindowWin32*)window)->processWin32TabletEvent(wParam, lParam);
00980                     break;
00981                 case WT_CSRCHANGE:
00982                 case WT_PROXIMITY:
00983                     ((GHOST_WindowWin32*)window)->processWin32TabletInitEvent();
00984                     break;
00986                 // Mouse events, processed
00988                 case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
00989                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(0);
00990                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonDown, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft);
00991                     break;
00992                 case WM_MBUTTONDOWN:
00993                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(0);
00994                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonDown, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskMiddle);
00995                     break;
00996                 case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
00997                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(0);
00998                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonDown, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskRight);
00999                     break;
01000                 case WM_XBUTTONDOWN:
01001                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(0);
01002                     if ((short) HIWORD(wParam) == XBUTTON1){
01003                         event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonDown, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskButton4);
01004                     }else if((short) HIWORD(wParam) == XBUTTON2){
01005                         event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonDown, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskButton5);
01006                     }
01007                     break;
01008                 case WM_LBUTTONUP:
01009                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(1);
01010                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonUp, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft);
01011                     break;
01012                 case WM_MBUTTONUP:
01013                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(1);
01014                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonUp, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskMiddle);
01015                     break;
01016                 case WM_RBUTTONUP:
01017                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(1);
01018                     event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonUp, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskRight);
01019                     break;
01020                 case WM_XBUTTONUP:
01021                     window->registerMouseClickEvent(1);
01022                     if ((short) HIWORD(wParam) == XBUTTON1){
01023                         event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonUp, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskButton4);
01024                     }else if((short) HIWORD(wParam) == XBUTTON2){
01025                         event = processButtonEvent(GHOST_kEventButtonUp, window, GHOST_kButtonMaskButton5);
01026                     }
01027                     break;
01028                 case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
01029                     event = processCursorEvent(GHOST_kEventCursorMove, window);
01030                     break;
01031                 case WM_MOUSEWHEEL:
01032                     /* The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is sent to the focus window 
01033                      * when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProc 
01034                      * function propagates the message to the window's parent.
01035                      * There should be no internal forwarding of the message, 
01036                      * since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain 
01037                      * until it finds a window that processes it.
01038                      */
01039                     event = processWheelEvent(window, wParam, lParam);
01040                     break;
01041                 case WM_SETCURSOR:
01042                     /* The WM_SETCURSOR message is sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor
01043                      * to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.
01044                      * This means we have to set the cursor shape every time the mouse moves!
01045                      * The DefWindowProc function uses this message to set the cursor to an 
01046                      * arrow if it is not in the client area.
01047                      */
01048                     if (LOWORD(lParam) == HTCLIENT) {
01049                         // Load the current cursor
01050                         window->loadCursor(window->getCursorVisibility(), window->getCursorShape());
01051                         // Bypass call to DefWindowProc
01052                         return 0;
01053                     } 
01054                     else {
01055                         // Outside of client area show standard cursor
01056                         window->loadCursor(true, GHOST_kStandardCursorDefault);
01057                     }
01058                     break;
01059 
01061                 // Mouse events, ignored
01063                 case WM_NCMOUSEMOVE:
01064                     /* The WM_NCMOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor is moved 
01065                      * within the nonclient area of the window. This message is posted to the window 
01066                      * that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.
01067                      */
01068                 case WM_NCHITTEST:
01069                     /* The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or 
01070                      * when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, 
01071                      * the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message 
01072                      * is sent to the window that has captured the mouse. 
01073                      */
01074                     break;
01075 
01077                 // Window events, processed
01079                 case WM_CLOSE:
01080                     /* The WM_CLOSE message is sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate. */
01081                     event = processWindowEvent(GHOST_kEventWindowClose, window);
01082                     break;
01083                 case WM_ACTIVATE:
01084                     /* The WM_ACTIVATE message is sent to both the window being activated and the window being 
01085                      * deactivated. If the windows use the same input queue, the message is sent synchronously, 
01086                      * first to the window procedure of the top-level window being deactivated, then to the window
01087                      * procedure of the top-level window being activated. If the windows use different input queues,
01088                      * the message is sent asynchronously, so the window is activated immediately. 
01089                      */
01090                     {
01091                     GHOST_ModifierKeys modifiers;
01092                     modifiers.clear();
01093                     system->storeModifierKeys(modifiers);
01094                     event = processWindowEvent(LOWORD(wParam) ? GHOST_kEventWindowActivate : GHOST_kEventWindowDeactivate, window);
01095                     /* WARNING: Let DefWindowProc handle WM_ACTIVATE, otherwise WM_MOUSEWHEEL
01096                     will not be dispatched to OUR active window if we minimize one of OUR windows. */
01097                     lResult = ::DefWindowProc(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
01098                     break;
01099                     }
01100                 case WM_PAINT:
01101                     /* An application sends the WM_PAINT message when the system or another application 
01102                      * makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window. The message is sent
01103                      * when the UpdateWindow or RedrawWindow function is called, or by the DispatchMessage 
01104                      * function when the application obtains a WM_PAINT message by using the GetMessage or 
01105                      * PeekMessage function. 
01106                      */
01107                     event = processWindowEvent(GHOST_kEventWindowUpdate, window);
01108                     ::ValidateRect(hwnd, NULL);
01109                     break;
01110                 case WM_GETMINMAXINFO:
01111                     /* The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or 
01112                      * position of the window is about to change. An application can use 
01113                      * this message to override the window's default maximized size and 
01114                      * position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size. 
01115                      */
01116                     processMinMaxInfo((MINMAXINFO *) lParam);
01117                     /* Let DefWindowProc handle it. */
01118                     break;
01119                 case WM_SIZE:
01120                     /* The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.
01121                      * The WM_SIZE and WM_MOVE messages are not sent if an application handles the 
01122                      * WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message without calling DefWindowProc. It is more efficient
01123                      * to perform any move or size change processing during the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED 
01124                      * message without calling DefWindowProc.
01125                      */
01126                     event = processWindowEvent(GHOST_kEventWindowSize, window);
01127                     break;
01128                 case WM_CAPTURECHANGED:
01129                     window->lostMouseCapture();
01130                     break;
01131                 case WM_MOVING:
01132                     /* The WM_MOVING message is sent to a window that the user is moving. By processing 
01133                      * this message, an application can monitor the size and position of the drag rectangle
01134                      * and, if needed, change its size or position.
01135                      */
01136                 case WM_MOVE:
01137                     /* The WM_SIZE and WM_MOVE messages are not sent if an application handles the 
01138                      * WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message without calling DefWindowProc. It is more efficient
01139                      * to perform any move or size change processing during the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED 
01140                      * message without calling DefWindowProc. 
01141                      */
01142                     event = processWindowEvent(GHOST_kEventWindowMove, window);
01143                     break;
01145                 // Window events, ignored
01147                 case WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED:
01148                     /* The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place
01149                      * in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or 
01150                      * another window-management function.
01151                      * The WM_SIZE and WM_MOVE messages are not sent if an application handles the 
01152                      * WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message without calling DefWindowProc. It is more efficient
01153                      * to perform any move or size change processing during the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED 
01154                      * message without calling DefWindowProc.
01155                      */
01156                 case WM_ERASEBKGND:
01157                     /* An application sends the WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window background must be 
01158                      * erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an 
01159                      * invalidated portion of a window for painting. 
01160                      */
01161                 case WM_NCPAINT:
01162                     /* An application sends the WM_NCPAINT message to a window when its frame must be painted. */
01163                 case WM_NCACTIVATE:
01164                     /* The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed 
01165                      * to indicate an active or inactive state. 
01166                      */
01167                 case WM_DESTROY:
01168                     /* The WM_DESTROY message is sent when a window is being destroyed. It is sent to the window 
01169                      * procedure of the window being destroyed after the window is removed from the screen. 
01170                      * This message is sent first to the window being destroyed and then to the child windows 
01171                      * (if any) as they are destroyed. During the processing of the message, it can be assumed 
01172                      * that all child windows still exist. 
01173                      */
01174                 case WM_NCDESTROY:
01175                     /* The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The 
01176                      * DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY
01177                      * message. WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. 
01178                      */
01179                     break;
01180                 case WM_KILLFOCUS:
01181                     /* The WM_KILLFOCUS message is sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus. 
01182                      * We want to prevent this if a window is still active and it loses focus to nowhere*/
01183                     if(!wParam && hwnd==GetActiveWindow())
01184                         SetFocus(hwnd);
01185                 case WM_SHOWWINDOW:
01186                     /* The WM_SHOWWINDOW message is sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown. */
01187                 case WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING:
01188                     /* The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in 
01189                      * the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or 
01190                      * another window-management function. 
01191                      */
01192                 case WM_SETFOCUS:
01193                     /* The WM_SETFOCUS message is sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus. */
01194                 case WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE:
01195                     /* The WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window after it enters the moving 
01196                      * or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user 
01197                      * clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the 
01198                      * WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the 
01199                      * message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when 
01200                      * DefWindowProc returns. 
01201                      */
01202                     break;
01204                 // Other events
01206                 case WM_GETTEXT:
01207                     /* An application sends a WM_GETTEXT message to copy the text that 
01208                      * corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller. 
01209                      */
01210                 case WM_ACTIVATEAPP:
01211                     /* The WM_ACTIVATEAPP message is sent when a window belonging to a 
01212                      * different application than the active window is about to be activated.
01213                      * The message is sent to the application whose window is being activated
01214                      * and to the application whose window is being deactivated. 
01215                      */
01216                 case WM_TIMER:
01217                     /* The WIN32 docs say:
01218                      * The WM_TIMER message is posted to the installing thread's message queue
01219                      * when a timer expires. You can process the message by providing a WM_TIMER
01220                      * case in the window procedure. Otherwise, the default window procedure will
01221                      * call the TimerProc callback function specified in the call to the SetTimer
01222                      * function used to install the timer. 
01223                      *
01224                      * In GHOST, we let DefWindowProc call the timer callback.
01225                      */
01226                     break;
01227             }
01228         }
01229         else {
01230             // Event found for a window before the pointer to the class has been set.
01231             GHOST_PRINT("GHOST_SystemWin32::wndProc: GHOST window event before creation\n")
01232             /* These are events we typically miss at this point:
01233                WM_GETMINMAXINFO 0x24
01234                WM_NCCREATE          0x81
01235                WM_NCCALCSIZE        0x83
01236                WM_CREATE            0x01
01237                We let DefWindowProc do the work.
01238             */
01239         }
01240     }
01241     else {
01242         // Events without valid hwnd
01243         GHOST_PRINT("GHOST_SystemWin32::wndProc: event without window\n")
01244     }
01245 
01246     if (event) {
01247         system->pushEvent(event);
01248         eventHandled = true;
01249     }
01250 
01251     if (!eventHandled)
01252         lResult = ::DefWindowProcW(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
01253 
01254     return lResult;
01255 }
01256 
01257 GHOST_TUns8* GHOST_SystemWin32::getClipboard(bool selection) const 
01258 {
01259     char *temp_buff;
01260     
01261     if ( IsClipboardFormatAvailable(CF_UNICODETEXT) && OpenClipboard(NULL) ) {
01262         wchar_t *buffer;
01263         HANDLE hData = GetClipboardData( CF_UNICODETEXT );
01264         if (hData == NULL) {
01265             CloseClipboard();
01266             return NULL;
01267         }
01268         buffer = (wchar_t*)GlobalLock( hData );
01269         if (!buffer) {
01270             CloseClipboard();
01271             return NULL;
01272         }
01273         
01274         temp_buff = alloc_utf_8_from_16(buffer,0);
01275         
01276         /* Buffer mustn't be accessed after CloseClipboard
01277            it would like accessing free-d memory */
01278         GlobalUnlock( hData );
01279         CloseClipboard();
01280         
01281         return (GHOST_TUns8*)temp_buff;
01282     } else if ( IsClipboardFormatAvailable(CF_TEXT) && OpenClipboard(NULL) ) {
01283         char *buffer;
01284         size_t len = 0;
01285         HANDLE hData = GetClipboardData( CF_TEXT );
01286         if (hData == NULL) {
01287             CloseClipboard();
01288             return NULL;
01289         }
01290         buffer = (char*)GlobalLock( hData );
01291         if (!buffer) {
01292             CloseClipboard();
01293             return NULL;
01294         }
01295         
01296         len = strlen(buffer);
01297         temp_buff = (char*) malloc(len+1);
01298         strncpy(temp_buff, buffer, len);
01299         temp_buff[len] = '\0';
01300         
01301         /* Buffer mustn't be accessed after CloseClipboard
01302            it would like accessing free-d memory */
01303         GlobalUnlock( hData );
01304         CloseClipboard();
01305         
01306         return (GHOST_TUns8*)temp_buff;
01307     } else {
01308         return NULL;
01309     }
01310 }
01311 
01312 void GHOST_SystemWin32::putClipboard(GHOST_TInt8 *buffer, bool selection) const
01313 {
01314     if(selection) {return;} // for copying the selection, used on X11
01315 
01316     if(OpenClipboard(NULL)) {
01317         HLOCAL clipbuffer;
01318         wchar_t *data;
01319         
01320         if (buffer) {
01321             size_t len = count_utf_16_from_8(buffer);
01322             EmptyClipboard();
01323             
01324             clipbuffer = LocalAlloc(LMEM_FIXED,sizeof(wchar_t) * len);
01325             data = (wchar_t*)GlobalLock(clipbuffer);
01326 
01327             conv_utf_8_to_16(buffer, data, len);
01328 
01329             LocalUnlock(clipbuffer);
01330             SetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT,clipbuffer);
01331         }
01332         CloseClipboard();
01333     } else {
01334         return;
01335     }
01336 }
01337 
01338 int GHOST_SystemWin32::toggleConsole(int action)
01339 {
01340     switch(action)
01341     {
01342         case 3: //hide if no console
01343             {
01344                 DWORD sp = GetCurrentProcessId();
01345                 HANDLE ptree = CreateToolhelp32Snapshot(TH32CS_SNAPPROCESS, 0);
01346                 PROCESSENTRY32 e = {0}; e.dwSize = sizeof(PROCESSENTRY32);
01347                 
01348                 if( Process32First(ptree, &e)) {
01349                     do { //Searches for Blender's PROCESSENTRY32
01350                             if (e.th32ProcessID == sp) {
01351                                 sp = e.th32ParentProcessID;
01352                                 Process32First(ptree, &e);
01353                                     do { //Got parent id, searches for its PROCESSENTRY32
01354                                         if (e.th32ProcessID == sp) {
01355                                             if(strcmp("explorer.exe",e.szExeFile)==0)
01356                                             { //If explorer, hide cmd
01357                                                 ShowWindow(GetConsoleWindow(),SW_HIDE);
01358                                                 m_consoleStatus = 0;
01359                                             }
01360                                             break;
01361                                         }
01362 
01363                                     } while( Process32Next(ptree, &e));
01364                                 break;
01365                             }
01366                     } while( Process32Next(ptree, &e));
01367                 }
01368 
01369                 CloseHandle(ptree);
01370                 break;
01371             }
01372         case 0: //hide
01373             ShowWindow(GetConsoleWindow(),SW_HIDE);
01374             m_consoleStatus = 0;
01375             break;
01376         case 1: //show
01377             ShowWindow(GetConsoleWindow(),SW_SHOW);
01378             m_consoleStatus = 1;
01379             break;
01380         case 2: //toggle
01381             ShowWindow(GetConsoleWindow(),m_consoleStatus?SW_HIDE:SW_SHOW);
01382             m_consoleStatus=!m_consoleStatus;
01383             break;
01384 
01385     };
01386 
01387 
01388     return m_consoleStatus;
01389 }
01390 
01391 int GHOST_SystemWin32::confirmQuit(GHOST_IWindow * window) const
01392 {
01393     return (MessageBox(window ? ((GHOST_WindowWin32*)window)->getHWND() : 0, "Some changes have not been saved.\nDo you really want to quit ?",
01394             "Exit Blender", MB_OKCANCEL | MB_ICONWARNING | MB_TOPMOST) == IDOK);
01395 }
